page.title: 05Change in Strelley Village
page.content: Mr Clarkson, Chairman of the Strelley Village Preservation Society says: "I think it is a pity that{Strelley {Hall}is no longer the main house of the village as it was in Miss Edge's time. But I think it is better to have a firm in it like PAFEC than to let it fall down. Mr Henshell has done more towards preserving the hall than you would expect. I believe that, where possible, if he has had to put a door way through he has used old blocked up door ways and pierced them and has retained the stable stalls for office cubicles. I don't think the{church will ever be knocked down because it's too important as a building. Perhaps some historic trust will look after it. But, in the future, as a religious building it will probably close down because there are too few people to form a congregation."
